thread.title: Stump sets receptions record as Wittenberg beats Hiram
thread.title_full: Stump sets receptions record as Wittenberg beats Hiram

title: Stump sets receptions record as Wittenberg beats Hiram
text:
Posted: 6:57 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 Stump sets receptions record as Wittenberg beats Hiram By David Jablonski Staff Writer 
Wide receiver Corey Stump set a school record with 16 receptions, and visiting Wittenberg rallied from a 10-0 first-quarter deficit to beat Hiram 27-10 at Henry Field on Saturday. 
The Tigers (5-2, 4-2) improved to 16-0 against the Terriers (1-6, 1-5). This was the closest game in the history of the series. The previous closest came in 2006 when Wittenberg won 35-0. 
Quarterback Zack Jenkins completed 31 of 45 passes for 316 yards with three touchdowns and two interceptions. The Tigers went three-and-out on their first two drives. Jenkins threw an interception on the third drive. 
Wittenberg scored its first points on its fourth drive. Ty Smith kicked a 30-yard field goal with 13:47 left in the second quarter. 
Stump caught touchdown passes of 17 and 21 yards later in the second quarter as Wittenberg built a 17-10 halftime lead. 
After a scoreless third quarter, Smith kicked a 26-yard field goal in the fourth. Luke Bowling ended the scoring, catching a 15-yard touchdown pass from Jenkins. 
Stump finished with 197 receiving yards. He broke teammate Zach Culvahouse’s single-game record of 14 receptions. Stump first hit that mark against Butler in 2014 and did it again versus Ohio Wesleyan this season. 
Stump fell one short of the North Coast Athletic Conference record. It was set by Oberlin’s Felix Brooks-Church against Allegheny in 1996 and matched by Kenyon’s Andy Pillay in 2001 against Denison. More News
